text: Some uses of Massive LAr Detectors
label: H3

text: • One use (of particular interest at Fermilab):
label: H4

text: – An excellent electron neutrino detector in a neutrino beam
label: H4

text: – Although the neutrino beam itself may only be ~10
label: H4

text: microseconds long, the electrons will take ~2 milliseconds to
label: H4

text: drift to the TPC sense wires
label: H4

text: – If it can be demonstrated that the cosmic ray background
label: H4

text: can be handled it may be sensible to locate the detector near
label: H4

text: the surface (under a few meters of overburden).
label: H4

text: – A detector under (at least ~50 meters of) dirt/rock cover to
label: H4

text: – This allows for nucleon decay, supernovae neutrino watches …
label: H4

text: and it can still be put in a neutrino beam.
label: H4

text: LaThuile Italy / David Finley, Fermilab / March 2007
label: BODY

text: Some Features of Massive LAr Detectors
label: H4

text: – It avoids various problems with large dimension objects
label: H4

text: – It does not “put all your eggs in one basket”
label: H4

text: – It allows for a staged turn on of data taking
label: H4

text: – Provides a trigger for natural processes such as nucleon
label: H4

text: decay and supernovae … and is very useful for sorting out
label: H4

text: background tracks in detectors in neutrino beams
label: H4

text: – ICARUS has shown it can be done on 300ton scale
label: H4

text: – Now it must be done better to be useful for massive scale
label: H4

text: Test of purging a volume from atmosphere (without evacuation):
label: BODY

text: Insert Argon gas at bottom of tank over large area at low velocity.
label: BODY

text: The Argon introduced, being heavier than air, will act as a piston and drive the air out of the tank at the top.
label: BODY

text: Fewer volume changes than simple mixing requires will achieve a given reduction in air concentration.
label: BODY

text: Cellular Design: An Alternate Wire Layout

text: In the previous design with angled wires, attached to the tank top,
label: H4

text: bottom, and sides, there will be some wires that do not reach all the
label: H4

text: way to the top.  Hence they cannot  easily be read out (without
label: H4

text: electronics immersed in the liquid, for example).

label: H4

text: the left, and 3 planes for electrons drifting in from the right.

text: For each plane in  the left triplet, there is a corresponding plane, with
label: H4

text: the same DC potential, in the right triplet.
